wiki.text:
]]

In Scottish usage, 'harling' describes an exterior building-surfacing technique
which results in a long-lasting weatherproof shield for a stone building. A
pigment can be embedded in the harled material, thus obviating the need for
repainting. Harling as a technique provides the surface of many Scottish
castles, but it is also used for a variety of common everyday building types.
Long-lasting and practical, it well suits structures in the Scottish climate.
wiki.title: harl
